Title: Business Expo West
Short Description:
Meet Business Leaders, Renowned Experts, and Make Connections to 
Grow your business at Business Expo West.
Map Location:
Tektronix, Bldg. 38 13600 SW Terman Rd
Beaverton, OR 97005

Title: Oregon Employer Council BOLI Lunch and Learn
Short Description:
2 BOLI seminars and Oregon Employer Council Luncheon:
10:00 AM Harassment Seminar
12:00 PM Lunch and OEC Lane Discussion
1:00 PM Oregon's Equal Pay Law
2.0 HRCI and SHRM credits pending
Details:
The Lunch & Learn will include presentations on two extremely topical HR topics presented by Bureau of Labor and Industries (BOLI), full details below.  You will also learn about the Oregon Employer Council, the benefits a local OEC chapter can bring, and how to get involved in rebuilding the Lane County OEC chapter.  Membership to OEC is free, and by joining and supporting your local council, you can make a difference in local employment and training issues, and create a vital link between business, education, government, and the workforce. 

WorkSource Oregon Lane
2510 Oakmont Way
Eugene, OR 97401

Title: La Grande basics notary public seminar
Short Description: Free training to become a notary
Details: Brush up your notary knowledge and get the answers to your questions by attending a seminar for current and future notaries public. This seminar is a comprehensive and thorough examination of notary basics: purpose, responsibilities and liabilities of a notary; how to notarize; notary certificates and the notary journal. What's more, this is your chance to talk to the state agency that regulates notaries, and participate in lively discussions about procedures, practices, and notary law.

Title: Coos Bay advanced notary public seminar
Meet The Primes Speednetworking Event
Short Description: DBE Subcontractors are invited to this Opportunity to Build Relationships with A&E Prime Contractors.
Details:
OREGON DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION
ASHLAND CONFERENCE ROOM
3930 FAIRVIEW INDUSTRIAL DRIVE SE
SALEM, OREGON  97302 
 
•	One-On-One interview sessions with A&E Prime Contractors
•	List of upcoming opportunities, contact information, typical clients and types of project the primes normally target.
    
This event is designed to help A&E primes build relationships with qualified DBE subs that will help the primes meet established project goals. 

DBE firms registering will be screened and expected to bring firm descriptions, services provided, references and contact information, ODOT certifications, insurance capabilities and projects their firm has completed. 

Target Subconsultant Specialties: 
1.	Geotechnical
2.	Survey
3.	Public Involvement
4.	Environmental Consulting
5.	Engineering
6.	Civil Engineering
7.	Drafting
8.	Endangered Species Act (ESA) Documentation
9.	Archeological, Historical & Cultural
10.	Right-Of-Way
11.	Landscape Architecture, Streetscape & Urban Design
12.	Quality Control (independent checks)
13.	Construction Inspection
14.	Traffic Studies & Design
15.	Urban & Streetscape Design

Register on Eventbrite.
Details:

•Maximize state certifcations through unique public contracts

•Understand how state certification helps you grow your business

Portland, Oregon 97217

Title: Governor's Marketplace
Short Description: Training, information and resources for entrepreneurs to contract with government. Meet purchasing agents who want to buy what you're selling.
Details: Small Business training, information and resources, including networking opportunities with purchasing agents.

Title: La Grande advanced notary public seminar
Short Description: Free advanced training for current notaries ONLY
Details: Advanced notary public seminars are appropriate for those who are experienced, commissioned notaries. They do not meet the training qualifications for a notary application and will not help you to pass the exam. These advanced classes discuss employee notary issues, notario and elder abuse fraud, difficult certificates, and journaling witnesses, among other topics.

Title: Governor's Marketplace - Ontario
Short Description: Connect to Public Contracting & Business Resources at Governor's Marketplace
Details:
The Office of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion/Affirmative Action for Governor Kate Brown is delighted to announce this edition of the Governor’s Marketplace to support Oregon small businesses.

We have partnered with the Secretary of State, Department of Administrative Services and the Certification Office for Business Inclusion and Diversity, to bring opportunities for businesses to meet directly with procurement professionals from state, federal, private and non-profit organizations who will share tips, tools, resources and strategies to aid in business growth, more successfully navigate contracting processes and nurture ongoing relationships.

A warm thank you to Treasure Valley Community College, Small Business Development Center for hosting our day. Also, a thank you to our sponsors who bring this edition at no cost to you!

All businesses within the state of Oregon are welcome. These events are held in different parts of the state solely to make the resources available to all.

We have partnered with the Secretary of State, Department of Administrative Services and the Certification Office for Business Inclusion and Diversity, to bring opportunities for businesses to meet directly with procurement professionals from state, federal, private and non-profit organizations who will share tips, tools, resources and strategies to aid in business growth, more successfully navigate contracting processes and nurture ongoing relationships.Free CE credits for construction contractors

Title: Eugene advanced notary pubic seminar
Short Description: Free advanced training for current notaries ONLY
Details: Advanced notary public seminars are appropriate for those who are experienced, commissioned notaries. They do not meet the training qualifications for a notary application and will not help you to pass the exam. These advanced classes discuss employee notary issues, notario and elder abuse fraud, difficult certificates, and journaling witnesses, among other topics.

Title: Governor's Marketplace
Short Description: Connect to Public Contracting & Business Resources at Governor's Marketplace
Details:
2018 Governor’s Marketplace | (Harney County) Burns OR

We have partnered with the Secretary of State, Department of Administrative Services and the Certification Office for Business Inclusion and Diversity, to bring opportunities for businesses to meet directly with procurement professionals from state, federal, private and non-profit organizations who will share tips, tools, resources and strategies to aid in business growth, more successfully navigate contracting processes and nurture ongoing relationships.

Date: September 13, 2018

Time: 8:00am to 1:30pm (Check in begins at 7:30am)

Location: Harney County Community Center, 484 N. Broadway, Burns OR 97720

NEW! Earn CE Credits. Through our partnership with CCB, Contractors can now earn up to 4 CE credits for attending this event. If you only attend certain portions, your earned CE credits will reflect the hours of participation

Title: Coos Bay basics notary public seminar
Short Description: Free training to become a notary
Details: Brush up your notary knowledge and get the answers to your questions by attending a seminar for current and future notaries public. This seminar is a comprehensive and thorough examination of notary basics: purpose, responsibilities and liabilities of a notary; how to notarize; notary certificates and the notary journal. What's more, this is your chance to talk to the state agency that regulates notaries, and participate in lively discussions about procedures, practices, and notary law.

Title: Rogue Valley Business Resource Forum
Short Description: Register for FREE There is no other event in the Rogue Valley that brings together representatives from all over Oregon to answer your questions
Details: Get free consultations with representatives from the State of Oregon and local banking, insurance, government, and trade organizations; learn how to access public agency contracting through The Governor’s Marketplace; get business tips from experienced entrepreneurs; attend seminars that cover up-to-date topics for all stages of your business; learn about available resources to help your business thrive; network with other entrepreneurs

Title: Winter Career Expo
Short Description: Career Fair
Details: Students at Oregon State are doers. Problem solvers. Communicators. If you’re looking for some of the best and brightest students in the country (and who isn’t?), you won’t want to miss the Oregon State Career Expo. As a leading research institution with land, sun, space, and sea grants, our students are already innovators in their chosen fields. This career fair attracts approximately 900 students seeking jobs and internships in STEM fields, the arts, humanities, business, and healthcare.

Title: Eugene Job Fair
Short Description: Valley River Inn
Details: This Job Fair offers great resources to job seekers who are looking to find a job or advance their career. It offers  pre-event training on how to get the most out of the Job Fair experience, as well as a mid-session workshop designed to empower job seekers in their search. It also offers advice on resumes, interviews, applications, etc.

Title: Albany Career Fair
Short Description: LBCC Annual Career Fair is FREE and open to the public
Details: The LBCC Career Fair is an Opportunity for students and community members to connect with local and regional employers, employment and staffing agencies to explore career opportunities and job openings all in one place. This event hosts approximately 100 businesses, both profit and non-profit, in a wide variety of industries, as well as highlights some LBCC programs and attracts over 600 students and community members seeking career and employment related information.

Title: Salem Capitol Connections
Short Description: Free networking meeting for businesses and nonprofits that want to sell to government
Details: Want to diversify your revenue streams? Consider selling your goods or services to government. Here's your chance to meet up with resources, buyers, and opportunities.

Title: OAME Trade Show
Short Description: Free attendance, paid luncheon. Designed for purchasers and buyers from public and private organizations to network with Minority, Women, Emerging Small and Veteran owned businesses.
Details: Meet public and private purchasers who want to buy goods and/or services from local small businesses. Celebrate all things small business as part of #SmallBusinessWeek.
Map Location:
777 NE Martin Luther King Jr Blvd
Portland, OR 97232

Title: Salem Capitol Connections-5th Anniversary Celebration!
Short Description: Free networking meeting for businesses and nonprofits that want to sell to government
Details: Come celebrate five incredible years of connecting small businesses and nonprofits with government contracts. Want to diversify your revenue streams? Consider selling your goods or services to government. Here's your chance to meet up with resources, buyers, and opportunities.
